content.question: During the day, solar radiation is absorbed by <math alttext="N O 3 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in its decomposition. Which of the following best explains whether the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere in the daytime is different from that in the nighttime, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be higher during the day, because the decomposition of <math alttext="N O 3 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> results in an increase in the rate of production of <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be higher during the day, because <math alttext="N O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will be in excess, leading to an increase in the rate of production of <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be lower during the day, because the decomposition of <math alttext="N O 3 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in the daytime will result in an increase in the rate of consumption of <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to reform <math alttext="N O 3 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be about the same at nighttime and daytime, because the amount of <math alttext="N O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will not be changed and the equilibrium will not be affected.
